Comment: Hi everyone, just to say that in this game it looked as though I was in yet another bit of bother.  I had an IQP that I seemed destined to lose.  But a premature king walk by my opponent resulted in me being able to turn the tables on him.  Hence the title.
2................ c5 - a symmetrical English.  This move dissuades 3. d4.
3. ............ Nf6 - the symmetry continues - it is an English Four Knights!

5. Nxd4 - one pair of pawns is exchanged and the symmetry is broken.  I can take the knight on e4 but then that only brings the Wicked Witch of The West on to that square.
